overview_of_class: This course covers the development of the group of people known today as African Americans. This history is rooted in the cultures of Africa, Europe and the Americas; the experience of the Trans-Atlantic slave trade; the exploration and colonization of North America; and the founding of the United States as a nation distinct from the rest of the Americas. Central to this history is an understanding of slavery and freedom; the development of ideas of race and racism; and the human rights struggle embodied in the anti-slavery movement, which would lead to the end of slavery in the United States.
name: Introduction to African American History: Key Concepts from 1700-1861
subject: HISTORY
